page.title: 16WELLINGTON HEATH ECOLOGY
page.content: A few years ago, 2 members of the Parish Council organised the clearing and marking with yellow signs, of {local footpaths.}Maps are available and walks suggested in a bi-annual letter. The mixed woodland, on good limestone soil, attracts many flora and fauna,ie badgers, and there is{concern}over a rumour that woods on the fringe of the village may be sold and felled. A 2 acre field has recently been planted with a{collection of native {British trees,}a space being left for {wild flowers.}A field at Longworth, protected by the Nature Trust, had 400 {green winged orchids}this year and also the very rare{Devils Bit Scabia. A small area in the village known as The Pleck (meadow), bought from the Malvern Hills D.C. has been{cleared of rubbish and{planted with tree-kits.
